org.hps.record.composite

Class CompositeLoop

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.freehep.record.loop.DefaultRecordLoop
      • org.hps.record.composite.CompositeLoop
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    org.freehep.record.loop.RecordLoop

    public final class CompositeLoop
extends org.freehep.record.loop.DefaultRecordLoop
    Implementation of a composite record loop for processing ET, EVIO and LCIO events using a single record source.

    • Nested Class Summary

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface org.freehep.record.loop.RecordLoop

    • Method Detail

      • isEtReadException

        private static boolean isEtReadException(Throwable e)
        Return true if the Throwable is a type that can be thrown by the ET system when it is attempting to read events from the server.

        The IOException type is not included here but can actually be thrown by the ET system

        Parameters:
        e - the Exception
        Returns:
        true if the object can be thrown by ET event reading

      • handleClientError

        protected void handleClientError(Throwable x)
        Handle errors from the client including any registered adapters.

        If the loop is setup to try and continue on errors, only non-fatal record processing exceptions are ignored.

        Overrides:
        handleClientError in class org.freehep.record.loop.DefaultRecordLoop
        Parameters:
        x - the error that occurred

      • handleSourceError

        Overrides:
        handleSourceError in class org.freehep.record.loop.DefaultRecordLoop
        Parameters:
        x - the error that occurred

      • isIgnorable

        private boolean isIgnorable(Throwable x)

        Return true if an error is ignore-able.

        If stopOnErrors is true, then this method always returns false. Otherwise, the error's cause determines whether the loop can continue processing.

        The assumption here is that errors coming from event processing of the composite records are caught in the adapters and then wrapped in a RecordProcessingException. Certain errors which should never be ignored are also wrapped in a similar way, so we need to check for these error types before assuming that event processing can continue.

        Parameters:
        x - the error that occurred
        Returns:
        true if the error is ignorable

      • isPaused

        public boolean isPaused()
        Return true if the loop is paused.
        Returns:
        true if loop is paused

      • loop

        public long loop(long number)
        Loop over events from the source.
        Parameters:
        number - the number of events to process or -1L to process until record source is exhausted
        Returns:

      • setConfiguration

        public void setConfiguration(Object object)

        For this class, the object should have the type CompositeLoopConfiguration.

        Specified by:

      • setStopOnErrors

        public void setStopOnErrors(boolean stopOnErrors)
        Set to true in order to have this loop stop on all event processing errors.

        Certain types of fatal errors will never be ignored regardless of this setting.

        Parameters:
        stopOnErrors - true for this loop to stop on errors
